content.webTitle: CD: Throbbing Gristle,  Part Two: the Endless Not

fields.headline: Throbbing Gristle,  Part Two: the Endless Not
fields.bodyText: Since Throbbing Gristle's last album in 1981, their singer Genesis P-Orridge, the self-styled bad boy of industrial rock, has sprouted breasts and now resembles the unholy union of Reg Varney and Katie Price (albeit with tattoos and piercings). TG's music hasn't undergone as much of a radical transformation. It sounds like creepy supper club music, the kind of thing Mohamed al-Fayed might commission to have piped through the halls of Harrods as a requiem to Diana and Dodi. Predictably, it lingers in the air like a bad smell.
